rule: Use JSDoc comments for all functions, especially exported ones
suggested_fix: Add /** @param {type} name - description @returns {type} description */ above functions

rule: Document complex algorithms and business logic with inline comments
suggested_fix: Add comments explaining why code exists, not just what it does

rule: Use const for variables that don't change, let for variables that do - never use var
suggested_fix: Replace 'var x = 5' with 'const x = 5' or 'let x = 5' based on whether it changes

rule: Use camelCase for variables and functions, PascalCase for classes
suggested_fix: Functions: calculatePower(), variables: motorSpeed, classes: EnergyMonitor

rule: Always use semicolons to terminate statements
suggested_fix: Add semicolons at the end of statements: const x = 5; not const x = 5

rule: Use arrow functions for callbacks and short functions
suggested_fix: Replace function callbacks with arrow functions: arr.map(x => x * 2)

rule: Use template literals instead of string concatenation
Use destructuring for object and array extraction
suggested_fix: Replace 'const x = obj.x; const y = obj.y;' with 'const {x, y} = obj;'

rule: No hardcoded API keys, passwords, or secrets
suggested_fix: Move secrets to environment variables and use process.env.API_KEY or .env files

rule: Validate and sanitize all user input
suggested_fix: Add input validation before processing user data to prevent injection attacks

rule: Use async/await instead of promise chains for better readability
suggested_fix: Replace .then().catch() chains with try { await } catch blocks

rule: Always handle promise rejections with .catch() or try-catch
suggested_fix: Add .catch(err => handleError(err)) or wrap await in try-catch blocks

rule: Use strict equality (=== and !==) instead of loose equality (== and !=)
suggested_fix: Replace 'if (x == 5)' with 'if (x === 5)' to avoid type coercion bugs

rule: Keep functions small and focused - one function, one purpose
suggested_fix: Break large functions into smaller helper functions with clear responsibilities

rule: Check for null/undefined before accessing object properties
suggested_fix: Add checks: if (obj && obj.prop) or use optional chaining: obj?.prop

rule: Use spread operator for array/object copies instead of manual iteration
suggested_fix: Replace manual copying with spread: const copy = [...array] or {...object}

rule: Remove console.log() statements before production deployment
suggested_fix: Replace console.log with proper logging library or remove debug statements
